ygData.subject: RE: instrument switching and inventory
ygData.msgSnippet: You can fill your main inv slots with things to force auto-loot to put the item into a container slot. Then position a backpack or other container on your hot
ygData.messageBody:
You can fill your main inv slots with things to force auto-loot to put the
item into a container slot. Then position a backpack or other container on
your hot key pad and click it open for wep/instrument switches.

I generally move the looted item to a container after auto-looting.

The other 'trick' would be using the range weapon slot to hold a wep - just
don't hit range wep and toss that dirk into a passing orc pawn! That's if
you don't carry actual range weps.

Sylly


-----Original Message-----
From: Jesse [mailto:j@...]
Sent: Friday, July 16, 1999 3:37 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] instrument switching and
inventory

From: Jesse <j@...>


Er, don't you drop it while weaving songs and selecting mobs
and moving
around and looking around?

> I know a lot of people don't trust it, but here's what I
do. I leave my shield
> (or second weapon) on my cursor. If you die or get
disconnected the item just
> goes back into your inventory so it is safe.
>
> Taelin
>
> > I was wondering, is there any trick to keeping those
inventory slots open
> > (i.e. free of random loot) without manually having to
put every item into
> > a bag? I bought a mandolin and horn to fill 2 more
slots, but there's
> > still 1 empty slot (which needs to stay empty, so when I
swap out 1
> > instrument, there's room for a shield + weapon). Anytime
I look anything
> > it gets automatically dropped into that slot, which is
very annoying when
> > trying to switch weapons later.
> >
> > Hopefully there's some good tips out there.
> >
> > Thanks, =)
> >
> > ---
> > Jesse <j@...>
